title: Reply Cancelling a Guardian of a Child

pages.name: Reply Cancelling a Guardian of a Child

elements.name: cancellingGuardianshipDescription1
elements.title:
The other party has made an application to cancel the guardianship of a child.

Guardianship is who is responsible for a child. Only guardians can have parental responsibilities and parenting time with a child.

The Family Law Act provides that generally both parents will continue to be guardians even if the parents are not together, and each will have parenting time and parental responsibilities. This does not mean that parents must have equal time or responsibility for a child. An agreement or order about parenting arrangements can make all the child’s guardians share parenting responsibilities or parenting time. Or it can make only one or more guardians responsible for parenting decisions and time with the child to the exclusion of all other guardians.

In some cases, it may not be appropriate for a parent or guardian to remain a guardian. A parent can be removed as guardian by agreement with all the other guardians or by court order. If a parent is not a guardian, they can still have time with the child – contact – but will not have any parental responsibilities.

We recommend that you talk to a lawyer before you make decisions about your future parenting arrangements or guardianship of a child.

elements.name: FAQLegalAdvice
elements.title: Where can I get legal assistance?
elements.body:
Understanding the law and making sure you get correct information is important. If you get the wrong information or do not know how the law applies to your situation, it can be harder to resolve your case. Getting advice from a lawyer can help.

Lawyers: To find a lawyer or to have a free consultation with a lawyer for up to 30 minutes, contact the Lawyer Referral Service at 1-800-663-1919

Legal Aid, Duty Counsel and Family Advice Lawyers: To find out if you qualify for free legal advice or representation, contact Legal Aid BC at

1-866-577-2525.


Legal Services and Resources: Visit Clicklaw at www.clicklaw.bc.ca/helpmap to find other free and low-cost legal services in your community

elements.name: cancellingGuardianshipDescription2
elements.title: The details of the order the other party is asking for can be found in Schedule 8 – Cancelling Guardianship of a Child of their Application About a Family Law Matter. You will need to refer to their application for these next questions.

elements.name: agreeCourtOrder
elements.title: Do you agree the court should make the order?
elements.description:
Look at Question 1 on Schedule 8 – Cancelling Guardianship of a Child of the other party’s Application About a Family Law Matter. The application may be about more than one guardian or more than one child.

Select the correct statement below:

choices.text: I agree the court should make the order as requested by the other party

I agree to some but not all of the order requested by the other party
If the application is about more than one guardian or more than one child, you might agree to the order about only one of those people or children.
I do not agree the court should make the order requested by the other party.
